imprison.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to put someone in prison or to keep them somewhere and prevent them from leaving
imprison.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The government imprisoned all opposition leaders.
She was imprisoned within his strong arms.
imprison.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if a situation or feeling imprisons people, it restricts what they can do
imprison.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Many elderly people feel imprisoned in their own homes.
